greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle of numbers k that have A238895(n) as the sum of the proper divisors of each k.
comment: It is interesting that these numbers have a very simple factorization. For example, the terms in row 6 factor as 3*5^2, 5*43, 7*41, 11*37, 17*31, and 19*29.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 2..51 of irregular triangle, flattened
mathematica: nn = 200; s = Table[0, {nn}]; d = Table[DivisorSigma[1, n] - n, {n, (nn/2)^2}]; Do[If[0 < d[[n]] <= nn, s[[d[[n]]]]++], {n, (nn/2)^2}]; t = {}; mx = -1; Do[If[s[[n]] > mx, mx = s[[n]]; AppendTo[t, {n, mx}]], {n, 2, nn}]; t2 = Transpose[t][[1]]; Table[Flatten[Position[d, n]], {n, t2}]
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Mar 28 2014
